moves.1. e4 f5 2. Qh5+: Quickly, in 2 moves, white manages to check.
moves.2... g6: This pawn is black's ONLY means of defence.
moves.3. Bc4 d5 4. Bb5+: In two MORE moves, white checks.
moves.5... Kd8 6. Qxg8 Qxb5: Blinded, black DOESN'T capture white's queen.
moves.7... dxe4: ...But not captured! Has black got something up his sleeve?
AND EN-PASSENT FROM BLACK! So he did have something up his sleeve.
moves.11. Kxf1 e5 12. Qxf8+ Rxf8: ...Or a fair exchange? Now white is blinded, by greediness, and checks. Only to be captured by black!
moves.13. d4 exd4 14. Bg5+: Get ready for an Era of checks. (by white)
moves.14... Kd7 15. Nd2 Kc6 16. Rc1+: A sneaky move by white proves a good position on the board.
moves.16... Kd6 17. Bf4+: Another check for white...But who will mate?
moves.19... Kf6 20. Bg5+: White is going skyhigh with checks.
moves.20... Kxg5 21. Re5: The king has a 'pawn protection' here...
moves.22... Kg4 23. f3+: A pawn gives of a nasty attack. The king is practically already checkmated.
moves.23... Kh4 24. g3+: He moves away, but is threatened by a pawn. Only one move left...
moves.24... Kh3: To hide in his opponent's kingdom. Doing this is unwise-
moves.25. Rh5#: -It gives your opponent an easy checkmate.
